member.name: T:Json.More.JsonDocumentEqualityComparer
member.summary: Calculates equality between two s.
member.remarks:
This comparison is compliant with the ideals expressed by JSON:
- Objects are unordered. - Arrays are ordered.

member.summary: A singleton instance for convenience.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified objects are equal.

The second object of type T to compare.
member.returns: true if the specified objects are equal; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns a hash code for the specified object.
member.param: The for which a hash code is to be returned.
member.returns: A hash code for the specified object.
member.exception: The type of obj is a reference type and obj is null.

member.name: T:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension functionality for .

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.IsEquivalentTo(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode,System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Determines JSON-compatible equivalence.
member.returns: `true` if the element are equivalent; `false` otherwise.
member.remarks: has trouble testing numeric equality when `decimal` is involved. As such, it is still advised to use this method instead. See https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/97490.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.GetEquivalenceHashCode(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generate a consistent JSON-value-based hash code for the element.
member.param: Maximum depth to calculate. Default is -1 which utilizes the entire structure without limitation.
member.remarks:
See the following for discussion on why the default implementation is insufficient:
- https://github.com/json-everything/json-everything/issues/76 - https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/33388

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.AsJsonString(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Gets JSON string representation for , including null support.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.GetNumber(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonValue)
member.summary: Gets a node's underlying numeric value.
member.returns: Gets the underlying numeric value, or null if the node represented a non-numeric value.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.GetInteger(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonValue)
member.summary: Gets a node's underlying numeric value if it's an integer.
member.returns: Gets the underlying numeric value if it's an integer, or null if the node represented a non-integer value.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.GetString(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonValue)
member.summary: Gets a node's underlying string value.
member.returns: Gets the underlying string value, or null.
member.remarks: JsonNode may use a under the hood which subsequently contains a string. This means that `JsonNode.GetValue<string>()` will not work as expected.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.GetBool(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonValue)
member.summary: Gets a node's underlying boolean value.
member.returns: Gets the underlying boolean value, or null.
member.remarks: JsonNode may use a under the hood which subsequently contains a boolean. This means that `JsonNode.GetValue<bool>()` will not work as expected.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.TryGetValue(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonObject,System.String,System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode@,System.Exception@)
member.summary: Convenience method that wraps and catches argument exceptions.
member.param: The node under the property name if it exists and is singular; null otherwise.
An exception if one was thrown during the access attempt.
member.returns: true if the property exists and is singular within the JSON data.
member.remarks: throws an if the node was parsed from data that has duplicate keys. Please see https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/70604 for more information.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.ToJsonArray(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode})
member.summary: Creates a new by copying from an enumerable of nodes.
member.remarks: `JsonNode` may only be part of a single JSON tree, i.e. have a single parent. Copying a node allows its value to be saved to another JSON tree.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.GetPathFromRoot(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a JSON Path string that indicates the node's location within its JSON structure.
member.param: Determines whether shorthand syntax is used when possible, e.g. `$.foo`.
member.exception: Null nodes cannot be located as the parent cannot be determined.
member.returns: A string containing a JSON Path.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonNodeExtensions.GetPointerFromRoot(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.summary: Gets a JSON Pointer string that indicates the node's location within its JSON structure.
member.exception: Null nodes cannot be located as the parent cannot be determined.
member.returns: A string containing a JSON Pointer.

member.summary: Instance constructor.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureGuardAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified public static boolean get-only property guards access to the specified feature.
member.remarks: Analyzers can use this to prevent warnings on calls to code that is annotated as requiring that feature, when the callsite is guarded by a call to the property.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureGuardAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified feature type.
member.param: The type that represents the feature guarded by the property.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureGuardAttribute.FeatureType
member.summary: The type that represents the feature guarded by the property.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureSwitchDefinitionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified public static boolean get-only property corresponds to the feature switch specified by name.
member.remarks: IL rewriters and compilers can use this to substitute the return value of the specified property with the value of the feature switch.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureSwitchDefinitionAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified feature switch name.
member.param: The name of the feature switch that provides the value for the specified property.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.FeatureSwitchDefinitionAttribute.SwitchName
member.summary: The name of the feature switch that provides the value for the specified property.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisableUserUnhandledExceptionsAttribute
member.summary: If a .NET Debugger is attached which supports the Debugger.BreakForUserUnhandledException(Exception) API, this attribute will prevent the debugger from breaking on user-unhandled exceptions when the exception is caught by a method with this attribute, unless BreakForUserUnhandledException is called.
